p: My sincere thanks come for your remembering me with a first copy of THE SPLENDID WAYFARING.
Ethel would have liked reading it with me, and us one would have been more appreciative of your writing.
Now that she is gone I shall cherish
more than ever the delightful photograph I made of the two of you.
I shall call you one day this fall, and perhaps we can have a quiet talk.
